Data Engineering August 19, 2025 Data Droid

What is Data Lakehouse?

lakehouse data-architecture data-engineering delta-lake apache-iceberg

📖 Table of Contents

  • What is Lakehouse?
  • Limitations of Traditional Architecture
  • Benefits of Lakehouse
  • Key Technologies
  • Conclusion

🏗️ What is Lakehouse?

Data Lakehouse is an architecture that combines the advantages of Data Lakes and Data Warehouses. It was first proposed by Databricks in 2020.

💡 Core Concept

Lakehouse is an integrated data platform that simultaneously provides the flexibility of data lakes and the performance of data warehouses.

⚠️ Limitations of Traditional Architecture

Problems with Data Lakes

  • Lack of ACID Transactions: Difficulty in ensuring data consistency
  • Insufficient Schema Management: Data quality and validation issues
  • Poor Query Performance: Slow response during large-scale data analysis
  • Lack of Data Governance: Insufficient access control and audit functions

Limitations of Data Warehouses

  • High Costs: High costs for data storage and processing
  • Scalability Limitations: Difficulty in processing large-scale unstructured data
  • Data Movement: Data duplication and delays during ETL processes
  • Lack of Flexibility: Complex migration when changing schemas

🚀 Benefits of Lakehouse

🔒 ACID Transactions

Ensures data consistency and integrity, providing a reliable data analysis environment

📊 Schema Management

Improves data quality through schema evolution and version management

⚡ High-Performance Queries

Fast data retrieval and analysis through indexing and partitioning

💰 Cost Efficiency

Cost optimization through separation of low-cost storage and high-performance computing

🔄 Real-time Processing

Integrated processing of streaming and batch data

🛡️ Data Governance

Provides access control, auditing, and data lineage management functions

🔧 Key Technologies

Table Formats

  • Delta Lake: Databricks' open-source table format
  • Apache Iceberg: Netflix-originated table format
  • Apache Hudi: Uber-originated table format

Processing Engines

  • Apache Spark: Unified analytics engine
  • Apache Flink: Stream processing framework
  • Presto/Trino: Interactive query engine

Storage Solutions

  • Object Storage: S3, Azure Blob, GCS
  • Distributed File Systems: HDFS, ADLS

🎯 Conclusion

Data Lakehouse represents the evolution of data architecture, addressing the limitations of both traditional data lakes and data warehouses. By providing ACID transactions, schema management, and high performance while maintaining flexibility and cost-effectiveness, it offers a compelling solution for modern data platforms.

Past

Separate data lakes and data warehouses with their respective limitations

Present

Lakehouse architecture combining the best of both worlds

Future

Continued innovation in unified data platforms

As organizations continue to adopt lakehouse architectures, we can expect to see more mature tooling, better performance, and wider adoption across various industries.
